required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Rapid Learning in Practice: A Lung Cancer Survival Decision Support System in Routine Patient Care Data

oversight_info.authority: Netherlands: The Central Committee on Research Involving Human Subjects (CCMO)

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective, data mining project that re-uses routine patient care data for decision support systems.

detailed_description.textblock: By installing tools that extract clinical data from electronic health records and image data from the Picture Archiving and Communication System, decision support systems are built and validated that can predict survival and treatment toxicities of lung cancer patients treated with radiotherapy.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective

primary_outcome.description: Retrospective data will be collected from each included patient from start of radiotherapy until end of study or death (an expected average of 10 years).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment until death,
secondary_outcome.description: Data will be collected from inclusion in the study until end of study of death (an expected average time frame of 10 years) concerning the local control of this tumour.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From treatment until end of study
secondary_outcome.description: Data concerning the possible occurence of distant metastases will be collected from each patient from inclusion until end of study or date of death (an expected average time frame of 10 years).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion until end of study
secondary_outcome.description: From each included patient, dyspnea scores will be collected from start of treatment until end of study or date of death (an expected average time frame of 10 years).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From treatment until end of study
secondary_outcome.description: Dysphagia scores will be collected from each participating patient from treatment until end of study or date of death (an average time frame of 10 years)

arm_group.description: Retrospective collection of data from included lung cancer patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients notes as suffering from lung cancer in at least one clinical data source.
